inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: IGF-1 level of 4.5 ULN adjusted by sex and age, random GH level is 4 ug/L

inclusion.criterion: History of inadequate response to trans-sphenoidal surgery or radiation therapy for GH secreting pituitary tumor
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago and has a residual pituitary tumor

inclusion.criterion: Willingness to discontinue other medications for the treatment of GH excess for a 6-week washout period prior to initiating pegvisomant
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient takes only vitamin D and multivitamins

inclusion.criterion: Able to provide consent/assent if developmentally appropriate
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Willing to use non-hormonal method of contraception in patients of reproductive potential
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Have a primary health care provider in home location who will perform regular height and weight measurements, vital signs, and safety labs
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Height and weight will be requested to be performed according to the published methods included in the CDC-NHANES manual on anthropometry procedures manual
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Liver function abnormalities (ALT, AST) greater than or equal to 3 times ULN
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Positive pregnancy test in females, current pregnancy and/or female patients who are breastfeeding
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients currently using opioids. Opioids induce altered metabolism of pegvisomant.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has Acromegaly due to pituitary adenoma and underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago.
